args: Put this article into one of the following categories. Use the most specific category that makes sense. If you are unsure, respond Other. The allowed categories are: Abortion, AI, Associated Press, Birthright citizenship, CFPB, Climate, Crypto, D.C., Debt ceiling, DEI in schools, DEI in the federal government, Department of Education, Deportations, DOGE, End birthright citizenship, Eric Adams case, Expanding executive power, Federal funding, Federal grant pause, Federal office space, Federal worker buyout, Federal workers return to office, Federal workforce reductions, FEMA, Firing government watchdogs, Food safety, Foreign aid, Foreign policy, Gaza, Government shutdown, Guantánamo Bay, Health agencies' communications pause, Health care, Immigration policy, Interest rates, Iran, Islamic State, Israel, Jan. 6, Kennedy Center, NIH, NYC congestion toll, Other, Panama Canal, Pardons, Reclassifying federal jobs, Sanctions, Senior government officials ousted, Taiwan, Targeting political enemies, Targeting protesters, Tariffs, The media, TikTok ban, Transgender policy, U.S.-Mexico border, USAID, USPS, War in Ukraine, World Health Organization Respond ONLY with the category. Trump allies rejoice, Democrats sound alarm over latest FBI appointment President Donald Trump announced Sunday evening that Dan Bongino — a former New York police officer and Secret Service agent turned right-wing podcaster and prolific conspiracy theorist — would serve as the FBI’s deputy director. The appointment quickly drew criticism from Democrats and was cheered by Trump allies. “Trump has chosen grifters to lead the FBI. Kash Patel sells ‘K$SH’ branded merch, vaccine reversal pills. Dan Bongino’s entire show is telling listeners the world is ending so they buy the dozens of survivalist products he sells,” Sen. Chris Murphy (D-Connecticut) wrote on X. “I know this feels like a bad dream. It isn’t.” Patel, a Trump loyalist who was narrowly confirmed last week as FBI director, praised Bongino and welcomed him to the job in a social media post. “Tremendous news for law enforcement and the future of American justice!” Patel wrote on X, calling Bongino “a warrior and lifelong public servant.” The appointment, which places a second Trump ally at the top of the FBI, adds to concerns about the lack of experience among those running the country’s premier law enforcement agency. The FBI deputy director role does not require Senate confirmation, but typically, such appointees have had long careers as FBI agents before assuming the role. “Even the WWE never constructed a tag-team better than: KASH / BONGINO We are making @FBI great again!” said former congressman Matt Gaetz (R-Florida), who was Trump’s first choice to serve as attorney general but was forced to withdraw his nomination because he did not have enough support from Republican senators.
